H0.text: In most constellations, which letter of the Greek alphabet was designated by German astronomer Johann Bayer to the brightest star. Β

H1.text: In most constellations, which letter of the Greek alphabet was designated by German astronomer Johann Bayer to the brightest star. Γ

H2.text: In most constellations, which letter of the Greek alphabet was designated by German astronomer Johann Bayer to the brightest star. Δ

H3.text: In most constellations, which letter of the Greek alphabet was designated by German astronomer Johann Bayer to the brightest star. Α

A4.text: Bayer assigned Greek and Latin letters to stars within a constellation in rough order of apparent brightness, from brightest to dimmest.

A5.text: Of the 88 modern constellations, there are at least 30 in which Alpha is not the brightest star.

A6.text: In astronomy, α is often used to designate the brightest star in a constellation.
